name: erosionally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to erosion (= damage to soil, stone, etc. caused by waves, rain, or wind): The area is rich in erosionally resistant rocks. This is an erosionally unstable landform. Related word
erosional
More examplesFewer examplesThe soft stone has been erosionally denuded, leaving bare rock surfaces.The valley sides are formed of erosionally resistant volcanic rock.Some of these areas are so erosionally sensitive that they should not be farmed. The river has erosionally resistant banks composed of heavy clay.A well-designed drainage system should be erosionally stable.
